title: Most enjoyable and caring.
body: I was in the Urology Ward for 4 dayâ€™s following a TURPS operation. From the time I was received into the reception then the operation and finally the after care, no words can I express the care and attention I received from the Surgeon, Nurses and support staff, in my eyes, they were all Angels sent from heaven, everything I needed was immediately attended to to aid my comfort and recovery. Thank you and God Bless you all, Richard (the jeweller).

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very Efficient
body:
Chec (Atria Watford)
Very efficient set up I am under their care 
For Glaucoma and I have had a cataract in the right eye done 
Very professional and they just get on with the job

title: Confidence in Staffing
body:
On 25th April I was given the first of my 3-monthly checks after bladder cancer and be given a 'thumbs-up' from the doctor. I was so pleased and when I got home I realised that I had probably not expressed my gratitude properly.
I am very grateful for all the treatment I received both at MMH and Maidstone Oncology unit where I had Radio-therapy treatment. Initially, I was suffering with a group 3 Tumour in my bladder which was treated which was taking up about 65% of available space. This was treated and approximately 95% was removed followed by a short stay in Sunderland Ward. Then I opted for Radio treatment to get rid of the final 'bits' at Maidstone and was amazed at the lengths they went to with transport to and from Gillingham. 
All in all I am glad the NHS facilities and considerate staff was on hand along with support from Macmillan staff to see me safely through what was/is a very traumatic time. I am pleased to say that I am feeling very well (for someone of 85 years old) and am slowly getting back into my garden which gives me great pleasure.
I am taking my time and stop when I feel I have done enough, knowing that there is always tomorrow.
Thank you for all your kindness and patience and I hope all staff can get through these dreadful times safely. Here is one very grateful patient who REALLY appreciates you being there when I needed you!
Brian Damerell

readBy.name: Medway NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible service not receptions fault
body: I was on the phone an hour in line then when answered I needed to make rather an urgent appointment not because im slightly ill a very important appointment which I was told phone back tomorrow . I am at work tomorrow its ridiculous .This practice used to be amazing now I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.You could be seriously ill but phone back tomorrow and we will fit you in within 2 weeks .Huh !  what a joke .

title: The most unresponsible/unresponsive  GP center
body:
I have filled up multiple forms for this practice to see a doctor, every time I received an email that someone will call from the practice or to send pictures of my problem without any link or information to where upload the pics ?? it's been 4 weeks despite calling the receptionist a number of times, they never bother to call for anything and I end up going to A&E each time.
Please request someone to take strict action against this practice.

title: Great doctor, terrible receptionist
body: The doctor I saw was amazing. He's friendly, knowledgeable, and was able to resolve a variety of issues I had. The receptionists are the opposite unfortunately. They are rude both in person and over the phone, which makes the process of going to see my doctor unpleasant.

title: Practice makes perfect
body: Struggle to get through for an appointment but when you do the service received by the GP is extremely good.

title: Very good
body: Most helpful setting up online services without there help i would not of been able to overcome setting online up

title: From terrific to Terrible
body: Doctors failed to sign papers properly, 1month wait for a doctors appointment, only to be seen by a nurse, and a very poor feedback and little care from practice manager.

title: A lifeline before sinking a 3rd time
body: I had an exacerbation of a mix of mental and physical conditions which were quite complex to unravel.  As a result, I went down the wrong road at first, thinking it was a bacterial infection.  And here's the key point - despite having had a phone appointment that day, which ruled out the bacterial infection (which appointment, too, I missed due to my error re timing and mobile charging status), because I still felt not my usual self, I was given a second appointment that day (the e-consult route didn't work due to it involving breathing difficulties) and the Doctor treated me as a person and involved me in reaching a diagnosis and course of action.  Both the efficiency and the good old bedside manner were outstanding.  She also helped me get an urgent repeat prescription for 2 drugs I had run out of due to being disorganized over the previous week or so.  The receptionists were friendly and efficient, inperson and over the phone.  The prescription dept was their amazing selves as usual.  As a whole Newton Place not only knows what it is doing, but it is staffed with people in every dept who really do care about their patients.  I'll stop gushing now...

title: Poor at very best..
body: Rude & unhelpful receptionists who seem to triage you & then decide if you can see a doctor!! Awful place. To be fair  the doctors are fine "when you can get to  actually see one.

author: Decde74
title: The staff here are all brilliant but long waits in A&E
body: I arrived with my child on Thursday night via the emergency department. We waited for around 6-7 hours before being seen to. There is nothing the staff can do when it comes to waiting times, but there is a lot of people there who are not injured or ill enough to be there. We waited for another while after being seen to then my son got an appendectomy. After his surgery we were brought here. The staff here are all brilliant, they are very friendly and helpful. They are giving us good updates every hour or so on how my son is. We are seeing a great improvement and are hoping to get home before the weekend is over. The food is okay and there is a great variety on offer. We are comfortable too.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Decde74
title: Long wait for surgery
body: I arrived with my son on Thursday afternoon via the emergency department. The wait was very long, around 7 hours. After being seen to we were brought here. The staff are very kind and friendly, but I am not receiving many updates. He is awaiting surgery, but we are not getting any feedback on when it is going to be and keep getting told the theatres are very busy. He is not getting any better and is still very ill. The food is good and there is a good variety on offer. We are comfortable here, the ward is very modern and private.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Decde74
title: The staff here are brilliant
body: I arrived here with my son on Monday morning. We have open access to the ward so we were put into this room straight away. The convenience of this is brilliant I canâ€™t thank the staff who organized it enough. The staff here are brilliant they are friendly and easy to talk to. We are getting good updates on how my sonâ€™s condition is. We are seeing an improvement. The food is fine and there is a good variety on offer for us. We are very comfortable here too

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Learning disability awareness
title: The care of my child with Autism and learning disability
body: My son developed mental health problems in December. He is only 13 and had to be detained under the mental health act and admitted to the Iveagh assessment centre in Belfast under the care of Dr McKenna consultant psychiatrist. It was a very traumatic time for our family. The professionalism, skills and care for my son was outstanding. I canâ€™t thank the nurses, care workers, domestic staff and all the members of the MDT enough for caring for my son as much as I do. We had to travel from Co.Tyrone a few times a week to see our son but the importance of this regional unit is crucial. There has been a significant increase in kids being diagnosed with autism and with that comes an increased risk of developing mental health problems. Services in the community donâ€™t always meet the needs of these children and general A&E isnâ€™t always appropriate when they become acutely unwell. We are lucky to have this assessment unit

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
Public Health Agency

author: Happylong
title: No complaint from me
body:
I attended FVRH at the beginning of April 22 for a procedure on my right ankle, this was carried out by Dr Drampalous.  
At the beginning of May 22 I received a letter from a senior staff member of Acute Services asking if I wished to complain about the 12 week treatment time guarantee not being met.  
I have absolutely no complaint about the waiting time or the treatment I received from the Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery Department at FVRH.  
The only complaint that I have is about the amount of red tape the NHS is tied up in so various interested parties can score political points.  
Thank you for providing an excellent service in these difficult times.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley
Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Exceptional care
body: My care has well and truly been exceptional so far and I am thoroughly grateful for the care that I have been given. The reason for the exceptional care is the nature of nursing that I have received in the hospital. They are always so happy and proud to do their job and not only do they enjoy their job, but they well and truly are exceptional at it. You can see the empathy and pain they feel when they make such a small mistake and their reactions would be the only way of anyone noticing. This passion is truly exceptional and something that makes their care so incredible. It is sometimes difficult to understand some staff members, due to their accent, however I do understand that they must feel in the exact same boat as me - the effort they put in to try and combat this is truly exceptional. The food that I have received so far has been very good and I love the excellent selection of food that we have every day. The place has an exceptional level of cleaning which puts any issues at ease. There have been no issues since arriving and I want to thank the staff for their care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The place has been a dream but turn some lights off
body:
My Care has been excellent so far and I am very happy with how much they care has improved since the last time I was admitted into the hospital. Everything that was an issue last time has been changed and everything the doctors tell me such as scans and timeframes comes into reality which I feel has made me feel a lot less scared of the process in the hospital as I now have a lot of trust and a good rapport with my doctors.  
I was also impressed with the staff I came into contact with in theatre as they were truly lovely and kind. All staff in general are the same they gave all taken time to explain anything I need to know as well as taking the time to answer NY questions that I need answered.  
Everything looks very clean with the painting making everything look very tidy. The food has been excellent so far and I have thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and have had no issues whatsoever in the hospital.  
The only slight issue I have is the sheer amount of electricity the place uses. The lights come on at half 8 and stay on to well after 10 oâ€™clock which with the rising cost of electricity must cost the hospital a fortune which if even reduced by 10 percent could save a lot of money for the hospital to use on other things. Apart from this the place has been a dream and Iâ€™m so thankful for my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Exceptionally good care
body: My care has been exceptionally good so far and truly has been at a different level ever since I arrived on the ward. The nurses and staff that I have come into contact with are so kind with the doctors being nice and tell me any progress or tests that are needed. I usually understand them however if I do not, they find a way of telling me and are always in contact with my daughter, who will contact me in a way she knows that I understand. They have been so kind in this and I appreciate it every day, as being able to understand the treatment has been crucial to my recovery and has really shown the progress I have made so far. The food that I have had is not my cup of tea and I really havenâ€™t enjoyed it, with it being rarity that I could eat 2 hot meals in a day. The staff have been exceptional so far and I have truly enjoyed the care that they have given me, as well as preventing any issues from occurring while I have been in the hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The quality of nurses is incredible
body: My care has been very good so far and this is due to the sheer quality of nurses that I have had the pleasure of coming into contact with. They are kind and have spent so much time just chatting to me which has made me feel a whole lot more at ease about the situation of being in hospital. The doctors are the same and I couldnâ€™t complain about a single one of them that I have had the pleasure of coming into contact with as they have all been truly superb. I am currently starting to get back to eating due to my condition, but the staff have been so accommodating and kind, always offering food and drink which is nice and is helping me get back to an actual food diet, instead of the liquid one I am current on.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: leopardqr57
title: Emergency admission
body: I had loss of movement of my limbs and couldn't speak (suspected bleed on brain). I was given an immediate scan and admitted to Osler ward. I was treated with dignity and respect. I've lost count of x-rays, scabs and blood tests I had. I could not have paid for better treatment. The doctors, nurses porters, cleaners and auxiliary staff were extremely friendly and professional. I feel there's a lot wrong with the NHS at the moment, but when they get it right they are unbeatable. Thank you.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Logiepug1
title: Stirling community hospital
body: My mum was moved from Forth Valley hospital to the Bellfield centre in Stirling. She was admitted to the Wallace suite. My mum had been in hospital for 5 months. I have to say, I wasnâ€™t sure about the move, but it ended up being the best thing that could have happened for my mum and us as a family. The hospital itself is lovely with a big airy room and the staff are second to none. My mum was at end of life and passed away 2 weeks ago, but she was so looked after in there. The staff really cared about her. She was always comfortable and cosy in her bed. Her her hair was brushed, moisturiser rubbed in, clean nails - they just took such good care of her in her final moments. 2 nurses stayed with us and one held my mums hand when she took her final breath. I can not thank or praise them enough. Such kind and compassionate staff, from head of the ward to the cleaning staff and everyone in between. I will forever be grateful that my mum spent the last weeks of her life there, and again, the staff are just wonderful - they are a credit to their profession.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very effective and excellent care
body: My care on the ward has well and truly been excellent and I couldnâ€™t say a bad word about a single thing that I have experienced in the hospital. The care has been so effective and it feels like I am getting so much better ever since I have arrived into the hospital. The doctors come round and are so kind and make anything that I need to hear easy to understand and answer any questions. The food has been good so far and I am very glad with the portions that I have received. I Have had no issues since I arrived and am impressed with my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been very good
body: My care has been very good so far and I have thoroughly enjoyed my stay in the hospital. The staff have been so good at looking after me and make things really easy to understand explaining any conditions or issues that have occurred in my treatment as well as procedures. The food has been very good so far but I am not used to the portion sizes so feel like I waste a lot of food that I get given. Everything has been spotless and the cleaners do a truly fantastic job. I have had no issues and have truly had wonderful care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: marley82
title: Ongoing wrist care
body:
I went to A&E on the day of the car accident at the start of September and I found out that I had whiplash. The day after, I woke up with my wrist not being able to move, pain, swelling, and stuck in the shape of a claw. I then went back to A&E a few days later, had an x-ray, and ended up being referred to the orthopaedic team. 2 weeks later, I had to have another X-Ray and an appointment with a doctor. At the first appointment, I felt like I was spoken to in a patronising way and left quite upset and still unsure of what was going on with my wrist.  
4 weeks later I had another appointment with the same doctor, who informed me that if it was fractured, there was nothing that the hospital would be able to do for it which left me confused. I was also told that the reason my hand was in the shape of a claw was due to me not using it, when I couldn't use it because of the pain I was in, which left me feeling like the consultant was blaming me for this issue. I then was referred for a CT scan. In December, I had another appointment where I was supposed to find out my results and didn't, and was told I could have regional pain syndrome, but that there was nothing they could do about it.  
In late January I found out I needed an MRI, which left me having to wait nearly 9 weeks to even find out anything. I have had no check-up appointments during this time and still to this day haven't had an appointment since January. I am left in ongoing pain, swelling, and a wrist that I am unable to use. I still do not know my CT results and MRI results. I was left questioning myself and questioning am I making it up? This has honestly affected my day-to-day life and from a hospital, I expect to be believed. Even though I am having these scans, I am still being made to believe that this is my fault by the consultant. After 8 weeks of waiting, I rang the reception, who said the letter had just been sent out. After 9 weeks of waiting, I was told in a letter from the MRI that one of the findings from the scan was I had a cyst (which isn't the whole MRI findings and CT findings, as I am having to find out my full results from the surgeon) and that I am referred to an upper limb surgeon. I rang up the hospital but they don't know anything about an appointment for me. I have been waiting a further nearly 3 weeks for an appointment when I haven't even had a check-up since January. This whole nearly 9 months of my hospital experience as an outpatient has made me lose faith in the hospital, with feeling like it was my fault, when I was getting sent for further scans. This is still ongoing and after 8 and a half months I'm shocked that I am still having to go through this.  
-MRI results I still don't fully know.  
-CT results from November I still don't fully know.  
The only good part about it is that the X-Ray, CT, MRI, and Physio teams have all been good and I have felt listened to by them.

readBy.name: Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: blackbirdpy78
title: Altnagelvin Hospital Labour Ward
body:
I was admitted to antenatal ward in April 2022, I was warmly welcomed by midwife, Maria, who cared for me for a few hours. Maria was amazing, she explained the induction process that I was admitted for and ensured I was comfortable at all times. I also was cared for by a midwife who's second name was McFaul on the night shift. Again, she was amazing, comforting and reassuring and taking into consideration my wish to transfer to labour ward for an epidural in a timely manner and ensuring this happened.  
When I went to the labour ward I met Sr. Joan. I immediately felt safe in the hands of Joan and knew she was very knowledgeable in her role. Joan ensured I received my epidural in a timely manner and escalated concerns when she became concerned about my baby's heart rate. Joan holistically cared for myself, my baby and also my partner, guiding him to the car in a hurry to grab his insulin before I was transferred to theatre, and helping him gown up appropriately. Joan then visited us in recovery to congratulate us and see our baby. I feel Joan is an absolute asset to the labour ward team and noticed the trust the doctors had in her, as they ask for her opinion on matters. I was reviewed by doctors Emma and Catriona who were lovely. They explained all their concerns to me and advised that an emergency c section was in my baby's best interests. I knew I was in safe hands with these doctors delivering our baby and I will be forever grateful for their prompt decision making and the trouble shooting they done, before deciding on the plan of care. Both doctors spoke to us after the delivery of our baby, congratulated us and ask if we had any questions about the decision made or the birth. Midwife Ashleigh also cared for us in the labour ward and recovery, and was very kind and reassuring to us both, staying after her shift to ensure all checks were completed and we were safe and well.  
I am so grateful to the entire labour ward team and will never forget how safe they made me feel in such a terrifying situation.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Staff but silly appointment system.
body:
Once again the 'ring at 8am and try and get an appointment' has been revived. The practice needs to return to a booking system.

Using your current system the practice discriminates against those working, those with communication problems especially those of us with mental health issues, those who are impoverished and can't afford the credit or waste of free minutes.

author: Welkc76
title: Endoscopy clinic, Ninewells, Dundee
body:
I was nervous about having a colonoscopy today, but I am delighted to say that the experience couldn't have been more positive. The department had a really relaxed feel to it, and all through the procedure I was met with kindness and cheerfulness. The receptionist was welcoming and efficient, and the nurses most attentive. And what a lovely gentleman Mr Pareeq, the consultant was! However, I was soon fast asleep after he introduced himself, and I never did get the opportunity to thank him for a painless intervention.  
Well done to Lynn, Marie, Fiona, Natalie, and the male nurse, who made sure the whole time in their department was stress free!

readBy.name: NHS Tayside

title: Great ultrasound
body: The nurse performing internal and external ultrasound was lovely - great bedside manner and very clear explanations.

title: Truly disgusting
body: Having severe anxiety, the nurse practitioner had me crying after the callback for my child. She called me and I tried to explain my child's issue, she instantly said to take him to a&e! She didn't let me finish and said if I brought him to the surgery she would sent him to a&e! Let me just say that although my child was experiencing some abdominal pain for the past 24hrs, he was currently awake, gaming. She spoke to me awfully, asif I was stupid. Telling me asif it was the obvious answer! I left the phone all feeling more anxious, deflated and upset. She had no compassion, no useful advice and I'm still square 1. If I thought for a moment that my child 'needed' a&e, we would be there in a heartbeat. It would be highly appreciated for your staff to show a little compassion especially to those like myself who are extremely vulnerable to anxiety issues. Phone calls are a big step for those suffering, we don't need judgement from health professionals.

title: Fantastic Administrators
body:
I have recently had to request a couple of pieces of information from the practice on quite a tight and stressful deadline in relation to occupational health.

The practice administrators have been extremely empathetic and caring in dealing with these requests, and worked to get the information very quickly.

Thank you for all of your help.

title: Absolute disgrace
body:
My mum who is 98 and been at this practice over 60 yrs has been treated appallingly -- there is no duty of care at all- after a hospital stay last year -- I have had to fight for any support - even ringing  Broadgreen myself for results which the surgery stated they had not received on more than one occasion!!
I paid a visit to the surgery after waiting 1hr 10 mins on the phone -- to be told no one was available that day 
8 different doctors have spoken to mum ( all locums)--
I was even told I was obsessed with my mother and my mother's care 
(My mum had septis and e-coli )!!!
 I did put in a formal  complaint which was eventually answered 5 months later 
Unfortunately it's just same old same old

title: Impossible to contact
body: I have been trying for 30 minutes to call the surgery. Tried to book an appointment online, to no avail. how on earth do I contact my GP? Can not do it online or by phone?

author: blackbirdpy78
title: Anaesthetics Team
body:
I was admitted to the labour ward. I requested an epidural and this was given to me by an anaesthetist called Laura. Laura was absolutely lovely, she explained the process, risks and benefits clearly prior to gaining my consent.  
I was then transferred to theatre for an emergency c section and Laura gave me a spinal block for the procedure. Laura was so compassionate and kind, she again explained everything to me in detail.  
Throughout my c section Laura and her male colleague (sorry I forget his name) were right by my side, reassuring me and caring for me. I will never forget how safe these two people made me feel in what was the scariest experience of my life. They were so compassionate and reassuring throughout the procedure, listening to my concerns and intervening where necessary to ensure I felt most comfortable. Laura also offered to take some pictures of us and our baby boy, which are memories she captured for us to hold forever. We wouldn't of even remembered to get these pictures as we were so caught up in the moment, so we are so grateful Laura reminded us and took these for us. Both Laura and her male colleague are absolute assets to the Western Trust, I will never forget them and how safe they made me feel.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Poor customer service
body: Having been seen at ECC yesterday and advised to see GP today for further treatment I called at 08.00 today to be told by receptionist that I didn't need an emergency appointment but to phone back at 10.00 when routine appointments were released but reassured that even routine appointments were triage and I would receive a call from an appropriate practitioner today. I called back at 10.00 sat in a queue and eventually got through to be told by exactly the same person I had spoken to earlier that there were no appointments left but to try again tomorrow. So I'm now waiting at home with a hot, swollen painful calf until tomorrow when I can try again.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Portsmouth

title: Excellent practice.
body: A very professional receptionist phoned me early to say I needed an urgent appointment. This was on the advice of one of the practice nurses. I attended and the young, caring doctor gave me excellent, helpful and in depth care for my condition. I received the best attention possible and left the surgery feeling more confident for a recovery from my problem.

title: Great practice
body: Thanks to everyone at the practice. You are a great team. Fantastic GP, nurses, AHPs, admin staff. Well done!

title: good pratice
body: I have been with this surgery for years and always found them to be a good doctors i have found the receptionist to be very helpful and always pleasant when making an appointment

author: aquariuspm89
title: Cancelled day procedure
body:
I was referred to gynae by GP via an urgent appt. My appointment with the consultant was brilliant, informative and helpful. I was admitted a short time later for a procedure. I followed the self isolation guidance pre admission, only leaving home to have my PCR two days prior, which was negative. On the morning of my procedure, my daughter dropped me off, I was welcomed, and told to sit outside the unit for further information. A nurse came around 30 mins later and was a little abrupt, demanding a lateral flow be completed. I didn't understand the rationale and was offered little explanation except for the fact that it had to be done, and they then told me to put my head back. I wasn't allowed the opportunity or time to blow my nose and the instructions on the LFT say this should be done before tests are completed, and as I suffer with sinus problems, I would have liked the opportunity to have done this. The nurse quickly went away and I was called in by a staff member, had some questions, and prepared for theatre. I was waiting in the ward when a nurse came in and said my procedure was cancelled, as I had just tested positive for Covid-19. They left quickly and offered no explanation, advice, support or help in any way with what my next steps were. I appreciate the situation was out of their hands, but a bit of respect, dignity and support goes a long way. I left after getting dressed, no one came near me, or asked how I was getting home, or if I needed something to eat or drink as I had been fasting. I appreciate we are on the other side of a pandemic but I felt that I was treated like I had the actual plague - it was a very demeaning and humiliating experience.  
When I eventually got home, I followed the guidance and isolated, however, I did a lateral flow once home which was negative (I believe my technique is fine as my daughter is a nurse and had taught me how to do them properly). I continued to test twice a day until my isolation time ended and I remained negative for my entire period of isolation. It's now around 5 weeks and I am still waiting for someone to contact me with a rescheduled date for my urgent procedure. I will keep trying to get a date. Whilst my initial appointment with my consultant was very helpful and informative and overall a great experience, the time spent on DSU has made me uncomfortable. I should highlight, I'm not questioning the fact that the procedure was cancelled, I understand the reasons etc, but I do have some queries/wonders about the testing process and the after part.  
When the lateral flow that become positive was done, there were other patients, is it possible mine was mistaken, or mislabelled, or mixed up? Are there processes to prevent this happening? What is the point in sending a patient for a PCR if a lateral flow is going to be done on day of surgery? I wouldn't want anyone to have the same experience as I did.  
Many thanks.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Frustration overload!
body: Trying to book travel vaccines - after trying to phone for over 2 weeks, 48th in queue, 46th in queue etc etc etc  ( I canâ€™t pop in as I work the hours they are open) and there being no online option like all other doctors seem to provide, I finally get to talk to someone who advised we need to collect forms to fill in, no online option. I get a family member to collect them and I make a special visit the next day to drop them off ( which made me late for work). All done I thought but then I donâ€™t hear anything for a few days so back to the phone queue I go and finally i get through only to be told the nurse who does them is leaving, when I asked about a replacement I was told they havenâ€™t interviewed for someone yet so canâ€™t help me. Why wasnâ€™t I told this when I phoned originally or even when I dropped the forms off, why wasnâ€™t your website updated with this info??? It seems everything is a shambles!!! My partner is at the spinney surgery, so easy there, submitted the forms online and they called the next day to make his appointment - fab service! This is not the first time I have received sub standard service since the two surgeries joined together, needing to contact or visit the doctor can be stressful in normal circumstances but the current set up just adds to the stress levels so even though my doctor herself is fantastic, the experience with the surgery as a whole is now just horrendous so I think after 35 years unfortunately it is time to change doctors.

title: Great Practice, Excellent Staff and Brilliantâ€¦
body: I cannot properly put into words how thankful and grateful I am to Woodlands and Woodlands Family Practice, they have done so much for me throughout the years and I am ever so grateful for the care and support that I have received and continue to receive. The Practice Manager is excellent (a remarkable person who cares for patients and staff alike) and the people that work there are highly skilled professional and dedicated people, from the receptionists, the nurses, the GPs and other health care providers there.. They deserve a lot more credit and recognition for the dedicated roles and duties they fulfil. They've been very good to me Woodlands Family Practice and I cannot praise them enough for the care and support that they have given me. The pharmacy is great also and the people there have been very helpful to me aswell. I consider myself very lucky to be registered with Woodlands Family Practice and the people that work there are a credit to the NHS, none more so than The Practice Manager who is absolutely fantastic..the people that work there deserve nothing but praise and support for the work that they do there. I have nothing but good things to say about Woodlands Family Practice and I would like to place on record my thanks and gratitude for all the care and support I have received via the practice. I have so much respect for the people at Woodlands and The Practice Manager... Thankyou Woodlands, Kevin Roberts

title: Head injury
body: Attending with head injury and from reception to nurses and doctor I had great response and care, lovely hospital

readBy.name: Hounslow and Richmond Community Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Awful
body: I feel so sorry for the Receptionist s at this practice. There is no option to get through to the manager so they have to deal with issues that they shouldn't have to and uses so much of their time that should be being used for medical issues. I needed to speak to the manager about something they had taken a big payment for ( a month ago) for my father's care and we still hadn't received the important document . I was 43rd in queue , got through, asked to be put through to a manager which she couldn't do. She was lovely, very helpful, very understanding and tried to solve the issue. I thought she had and was very grateful. I also felt for her and others trying to get through as she took a good20 -30 mins to sort ( or so I thought) . It was a complaint and  somethng a manager should have sorted. she did everything she could. We have since been told it's not going to happen. Too long-winded for on here and I am following up. My point is..I have worked for a GP surgery for over 10 years and I am so shocked by the running if this surgery.There is no email address, no alternative numbers that you can contact when you don't need a medical appointment. It seems to me Reception are having to do everything and cope with all the flack as a result.

title: The Most Caring Practice Ever
body: I just wanted to say a big thank you from receptionists to GPs for everything you have done over the years and especially the past few months for my 98 year old mother. Mum was in hospital for over 15 weeks and during that time contact had to be made with her doctor - whenever I called the surgery everyone was so helpful and always passed on messages immediately.  Whilst in hospital they managed to brake my mothers hearing aids and even though there was an audiology department in the hospital they couldnâ€™t get them repaired. My mother is now out of hospital, I called the practice and they are organising a â€˜homeâ€™ visit from the NHS company that supplied the hearing aids.  Thank you for being so caring especially to your elderly patients, it really is very much appreciated.

title: Great practice
body: I had reason to have a medical for a new job opportunity. The receptionist was helpful, polite and advised me that due to the surgery being extremely busy, the quickest way to get an appointment was to use e-consult. By using this facility I was able to outline my situation and requirements. I  received an SMS within 30 minutes requesting me to call the surgery. To cut a long story short, again the receptionist was excellent and helpful. Within minutes I was provided with a GPâ€™s appointment plus a separate one for a blood sample to be taken ( for my medical) and as my work is overseas I was also provided with an appointment to see the Travel Nurse to get advice on anti-malaria preventive measures. I was impressed with the service provided but also with the assistance from the receptionists. I have been with the Park Road surgery for 10 years and always received good treatment.  All staff that I have met have been courteous, helpful and professional.

title: A1 Care
body:
I had my 2nd visit to SpaMedica in Newark today for a cataract operation having had the pre-op consultation some 4 weeks earlier.
I was absolutely blown away by the level of care i received on both occasions that began as soon as i walked through the doors.
All the staff, and i mean ALL were so helpful and caring, it was like i was among long term friends.
The centre was spotlessly clean and i felt really comfortable. I cannot single any one person out for a mention as they were all so professional and friendly.
Well done one and all and thank you.
Neil.

title: Exceeded our expectation everytime
body:
I have been a very happy and satisfied customer of Heathcot Medical Practice for 16 years. They have served our family( 2 adults+ 2 children) with utmost sincerity and promptness and exceeded our expectation with their personal touch whenever we needed their help and attention.Easy accessibility and quality of consultation received from the practice makes them standout from rest of the practices in the neighbourhood.
Post Covid the practice has been strained on the resource front and we hope they will be able to address the challenge limited resources with increased number of patient call poses so that we will continue to receive pre Covid level of attention and support.

title: Amazing Support
body: My daughter was so poorly just over the bank holiday. I called the surgery expecting not to get an appointment. However, they booked me an appointment straight away and even managed to help rearrange my minor survey to suit. The reception team at both Weoley and Grange were amazing, particularly the young man at Weoley Park who went above and beyond to support us! Also a lovely female receptionist who helped tirelessly with her prescription. Both doctors we saw were wonderful and put themselves out to see my daughter. Wonderful service!!

author: Magnilia
title: Recent visit to hospital
body:
I had a fall unfortunately. I had broke my wrist. I was seen at minor injuries, Stirling. The nurse I saw was so helpful and understanding, as I was so nervous. The type of break I had required a visit to Larbert to see the orthopaedic surgeon.  
Once I arrived at Forth Valley, I was quickly seen. Angela, one of the health care assistants, was amazing. She really made me feel at ease. Also thank you to doctor Razii, who managed to avoid me having to have surgery. So grateful, I canâ€™t thank the medical team enough for helping me.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

title: Very supportive!
body: I am a new mum and have recently moved to the area and chose this GP as it was very close. The staff have been so busy this year with Covid but I have always felt supported and able to make an appointment. After every appointment I have felt listened to and taken seriously. I was previously very nervous about going to the doctors but now feel that I can get in touch when I need them. Cannot recommended enough!

title: Good practice
body: I saw a lovely Doctor this morning. She dealt with my health issue professionally and she listened, even checked my blood pressure. Very patient and lovely mannerism. Thank you.

title: EPAC - Absolutely amazing
body: I had to visit EPAC yesterday as I'm 11 weeks pregnant and had some worrying symptoms. I was treated with so much dignity and respect that I left feeling supported and cared for. The nurses there found out I hadnt even seen a midwife yet despite chasing (as I'm an out of area patient) and instantly sprang into action making sure I'd had all the required tests and booked in correctly, each member of staff were friendly and caring. I started this pregnancy feeling forgotten and ignored and left yesterday feeling supported and cared for. Thank you so much to everyone that day. I'm so glad we've chosen Russells Hall as our hospital to give birth in. Thank you again!

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Cannot fault this practice
body:
From the Doctors to the support staff and nurses, all are very responsive and take the time to deal with me and members of my family thoroughly.
I've never had to wait for a lengthy period to be seen. In one instance, I emailed a picture of a skin blemish and was seen that day and then booked in for treatment.
My brother has complex issues but was getting nowhere with his old GP Practice. He moved to Manor Surgery and is now receiving regular checks and treatment at the Surgery and Hospital.
If you want a GP Practice that takes the time to get to know their patients and where appointments last as long as is necessary as opposed to being timed then I would highly recommend this practice.

title: Excellent Diabetic review
body: The best review I have had in years, the diabetic nurse explained everything, made me feel comfortable. I arranged an action plan the was manageable and arranged a review in 6 months

title: Great mental health support
body: I have done 8 sessions of CBT and it was amazing. The Psychological Wellbeing Practitioner was very thoughtful and supportive while I was struggling, and made me see things with a different perspective.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Staff, never had a negative experience
body:
Fantastic staff.  Never been disappointed by this surgery.  Very friendly and efficient.  
I have to admit, I was a little wary about using one of their (non-permanent?!) Doctors, but pleasantly surprised.  I was completely put at ease and my problems were sorted very efficiently in a non-rushed and friendly manner.  I have been treated by all doctors in the same manner.
I think it's important to acknowledge the great work the receptionists and people that work behind the scenes do to keep this place running so sharp.  Admittedly there has been once or twice where there's been confusion over prescriptions, this is going to happen in any surgery, but the receptionists have always put this right in a timely manner.  This surgery has it all.  From your first point of call, you are greeted in a friendly manner.  Most often if the reception can't solve your problem immediately, they will call you back the same day, often within minutes.  
I feel so privileged to be part of such a great medical center.  Keep up the good work!

title: Good experience
body: I was greeted by a nurse who took my details and a summary of my injury. She directed me to the urgent care department where a very nice receptionist checked me in. After a very short time I was seen by an efficient and friendly female doctor who arranged for me to have an x-ray which was done very quickly. The doctor was able to show me the x-ray within seconds of returning to the unit, diagnosing a small fracture which needed no treatment. The whole experience was excellent, I could not have asked for better care.

title: Exceptional staff and doctors
body:
I wanted to post this feedback about my visits to the surgery in the past month and the staff has been absolutely amazing with the attention and care they have provided me. I see new faces and miss old faces. 

I've been served timely appointments, courteous manner over the phone when I've called, helpful and caring with my repeat prescriptions and most important your staff actually mention to me if there is anything else they can do to help me!!  

I visited today for my blood test and your staff wished me a happy birthday! receptionists and nurses and even a lovely patient who overheard the staff wishing me happy birthday! 

Surgery receptionists have been exceptionally brilliant and have booked appointments to see the doctor, and blood test appointments, and today one receptionist didn't allow me to leave without seeing the HCA for my blood pressure because she checked the system and saw it was long overdue - I find this to be exceptionally brilliant patient care. 

Well done to Forty Willows team!

title: Lovely staff
body: After less than 24 hours finding out that I was further along than I thought and therefore needed a surgical abortion I was feeling really distressed and overwhelmed about the procedure. My appointment was at 8:15am and we travelled nearly 2 hours so it was a tough morning. I experienced abuse as a child and so the thought of this procedures and being asleep was very scary. But everyone was so nice, explained everything so well and clearly without being patronising and I felt totally cared for and like I could ask anything. All the women clearly really cared and wanted to make sure I was OK and the two male doctors who did the procedure introduced themselves and gave me a fist bump. I am really happy I had this team helping me. Its a really hard thing to go through but they made it a little easier.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: CMacUnicorn
title: Medical Assessment Unit RAH
body:
I arrived at MAU in the afternoon, after being referred by GP for possible clots in my lungs. Turns out MAU had moved location and was in a completely different part of the building from where signs direct you. Due to my condition, I didn't arrive at the new MAU (which was situated in a day surgery unit) until about half an hour later. I wasn't seen until over 5 hours later and wasn't offered any food or drink until then. I think that's a long time for a pregnant woman to be left and not offered food or drink.  
Upon admission, I explained that I was vegan. The HCSW that night gave me soya milk in my tea but for the rest of my stay I was told there were no milk alternatives for me. The toast in the morning was already pre-buttered. No milk for cereal. I was never offered a vegan lunch or dinner (I was in MAU for over 48 hours). I couldn't get a shower the full time I was there as there were no shower facilities. I had to chase up my own chest x-ray to be reported so that a VQ scan could be organised before the weekend, because a doctor refused to phone radiology and chase it up for me, even though this was the only thing holding me back from being discharged with the suitable treatment. I was moved beds in the early morning on my second night. On the third day, I went to QEUH for a VQ scan and when I arrived back the same day, MAU had been moved back to it's original location, but I was to stay at the old, empty location. I had missed lunch and wasn't offered any. I wasn't discharged until after 4 hours later. No food or drink had been offered to me since breakfast.  
Nobody recorded hcg levels of my bloods.  
I was diagnosed with clots in my lungs and discharged with injections to take, but no follow up appointments could be made for me as haematology wouldn't take me because I was pregnant. Maternity wouldn't take me as I wasn't pregnant enough, so it was up to me to contact my GP and work out a plan on how someone could take me under their care to ensure my injections were the correct dose (I am now finally under suitable care and have been moved to a higher dose as the dose I was discharged with wasn't working as well as it should. Thank goodness I managed to organise myself outpatient follow ups to check my bloods or I would probably have had to be re-admitted to hospital). I believe the doctor and nurse who finally discharged me did all they could within their power but apart from that my care wasn't great. I was undermined and ignored and I felt like MAU was a lonely (and hungry) place to be. Someone could have at least organised a hot meal for me and to be able to use a shower somewhere. Thank you to the nurse who escorted me to my VQ scan and to the nurse who consoled me when I was crying. Thank you to the radiographer who took my x-ray and took time to speak with me and treat me like a human. Thank you to all porters I met. Thank you to the domestic who cleaned the room I was in. Thank you to the staff at QEUH nuclear medicine for being caring and understanding. I found peace in the chapel in RAH. I wasn't given any information about this but I found it myself and it did bring me some hope when I felt very lonely.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

title: Wonderful Care
body:
I am now recovering from a repair to my left Inguinal Hernia which 
was completed on the 6th May 22. I would like to pass on my gratitude to all the members of the team associated with this procedure.  I was treated with the utmost care and attention by everyone  Well Done NHS  A great Experience !!!

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: The telephone staff are very good. I had a consultation and it was very helpful. I needed to sort my query via NHS which the DR gave me a recommendation for as opposed to using a private paid service. Highly Recommended, standards are always good

title: Lovely hospital
body: First time Iâ€™ve been to this hospital for surgery on my wisdom teeth and I literally cannot fault them they was extremely caring not once did I feel nervous even though I was as they reassured me continuously throughout my procedure and stay in hospital all staff was very helpful and understanding very professional and well mannered would definitely recommend this hospital Iâ€™m gutted Iâ€™m not local to the area but to have been allocated this hospital for my surgery I literally am very happy with the whole treatment I was given

title: Great service
body:
I attended day surgery on Monday 9th May for a hernia operation.  I would just like to say from reception to the nurses, doctors, theatre staff and the nurses and health care workers on the recovery ward to discharge was outstanding from every single person that dealt with me.  I'm embarrassed I can't remember any of their names.  But would just like to thank everybody who helped and treated me on  the day.

Thank you
Neill wallace

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Jhmw
title: The wonderful staff at Hairmyres Hospital in East Kilbride
body:
I had to take my very elderly mother to Accident and Emergency at Hairmyres Hospital because her GP was concerned about her high blood pressure and breathing difficulties. From the moment we walked in, all staff were caring, kind, considerate and made my Mum feel very much at ease. From A&E we were sent to the Medical Assessment Unit where a student nurse and a junior doctor were particularly attentive and gave my Mum the treatment she needed. They explained everything clearly and answered all her and my questions without making us feel daft. There was lots of laughter in what could have been a very serious situation. My Mum loved that. They also gave us tea and sandwiches. My Mum was allowed to go home after several hours. We are very happy with the care she received and so grateful that there is a good NHS in Scotland.  
I donâ€™t often have contact with hospitals and often hear bad stories about them so I wanted to tell a good story.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

title: Always Get An Appointment
body: Always able to get an appointment when I call first thing in the morning. GPâ€™s are very thorough, friendly and helpful and will see you in person if required. The receptionists are also very helpful and happy to help where they can.

author: Libby78
title: CAMHS Nottingham
body:
My teenage daughter has been struggling with her mental health for several years but over the last year has experienced increased suicidal ideation, culminating in 3 attempts on her life in the last year.  
In September last year, after being discharged for the second time from the crisis team with no follow up I submitted a complaint via PALS and received a response in November stating that CAMHS had not acted appropriately in my childs case regarding all of the issues I raised. By this point I was told my child would be placed on a waiting list for support with the South Team and we would be placed on a waiting list for family therapy. Unfortunately we are still waiting in May 2022 and, understanding that I had been battling to try and be taken seriously and get support for my daughter we were asked if she would like to take part in a study into trauma in January 2022. As we had received nothing else and my daughter was struggling to cope with daily life we agreed as we felt that something was better than nothing. Unfortunately my daughter did not possess the coping strategies to deal with the study and attempted suicide for the third time in February 2022, each time going one step further in a cry for help. During the assessment at the hospital the following day with a member of the Crisis Team I had to actually tell her to stop talking over me and let me speak, my daughter feels the same way as I do when I say that she did not listen to either of us until I said that. Surely that is not productive when trying to assess the needs and mental state of the young person involved?  
As a family this has taken it's toll on us, to the point that my younger child is now struggling to cope with what has happened and is now needing support too. It is affecting schooling at a critical time in my children's academic lives as they struggle to attend, my job is now at risk because of the time off I have had to have to support my children, my children barely go out of their rooms and almost 11 weeks after the third attempt we are still being seen by the Crisis Team and not a care coordinator for the South Team. My child hardly sleeps and can go 2 or 3 days on just a couple of hours sleep in total, she did not attend school 2 days ago because her thoughts to harm herself were so bad she refused to get out of bed because she was terrified and we had to call the Crisis Team for support. The 2 team members in the Crisis Team were only supposed to offer 6 weeks support yet 11 weeks in we are still under them as they cannot get my child the support needed from the South Team yet but they are not in place for such a role. I called the South Team 2 days ago to ask if my child was being picked up yet as it is almost 2 weeks since the Crisis Team submitted an IR1 form regarding the delay in working with my child and was told that someone would call me back between 2pm and 5pm that day, over 48 hours later I am still waiting and in the meantime the Crisis medic will not do a medic review because my child is open to the South Team and it should apparently be their medic that does the review. In the meantime my child has to try and deal with her own negative thoughts on very little sleep, not a very good combination.  
I have submitted my second thorough complaint to PALS regarding the service offered and will be discussing CAMHS support with my local MP in conjunction with the student support manager from my children's school as the service offered to not just my children but all young people desperately needing help is severely lacking and at a critical level.  
With the dramatic increase in a need for such an essential service something needs to change and quickly, parents and young people should not have to face such a battle to try and access help or be heard. I have only briefly skimmed the surface with the difficulties we are facing right now regarding CAMHS support, particularly within a community setting and if we are experiencing this then there has to be thousands more families in the same position. As a mother my heart is breaking every day seeing my children struggle with their mental health and feel so alone and hopeless. I just hope that I can keep my child safe whilst we wait for the support because I dread to think of the alternative.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: older devon maid
title: COVID-19 elective self-swab service
body:
I was sent a self-swab in anticipation of a day case cataract operation in 3 days time. Using the template suggested for comments:  
* I have not previously attended the testing cell at NDDH  
* Able to do test without attending medical centre  
* As retired person no serious challenges from isolation except from not being able to follow normal routines of shopping and visiting local town  
* To visit NDDH is 2 hour round trip covering 50 miles in total; to deliver to drop off at Holsworthy Hospital was a 40 minute round trip covering 12 miles in total  
* Info leaflet was good.  
* Swab pack arrived about 10 days before date for swab  
* Service was fine

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: sagittaww56
title: Orthopaedic
body: We were referred to the trauma ward at Altnagelvin. After a difficult long journey. we initially felt ignored, but after 1 1/2 hours the Doctor in Orthopaedics met us and was just wonderful, I could not begin to thank them enough. They took away fears and concerns and was a true blessing to meet. We prayed for the right help and we got it.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Terrible, forgotten about, left uniformed
body:
Terrible experience, I can fully understand long waits due to being at capacity and only 2 doctors. BUT when your wasted 7 hour wait was due nurses â€˜forgettingâ€™ to re call you after your urine sample had been left too long to check so had to re do then being left another 1.5 hours before the second sample is checked ( I must add this was also after needing to enquire about it twice )   Then left another 1.5 until I had to go and check myself again the results. Only to be told â€˜oh they were negative, so you should of left    ( no one had told us so weâ€™d just been sat there uninformed) Unless wanted to see the doctor, but I must add that because of the delays we will probably be closed when itâ€™s your turn ?    Left feeling like a forgotten number and had to try and get a doctor apt the next day only to find out I did indeed have a water infection and they had left it too late for it to show up when tested.  
I would never recommend

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Maddisonsmum444
title: A&E experience with autistic child.
body:
My child is non verbal, 4 years old and poorly.  
After ringing out of hours we were advised to go to A&E, a place I dread going and frequent a lot due to my childâ€™s disability. This time however, was amazing, due to the new sensory room available. No more stares and making people feel uncomfortable with a screaming child who can not communicate, no worrying about her touching people and their things or trying to leave through the main doors. First positive experience of a hospital visit in my four years of sen parenting! Thank you Altnagelvin!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Suboptimal care and
body: After being sent by GP, we found ourselves with a 10 weeks baby with fever, waiting for 6 hours in the A&E department for an urine sample examination. This was their explanation for a dipstick test.. not to mention that I had to show one of the doctors where the GP notes are in the red book, as she said there are none in there..and had no idea where to look after those notes. After we lost our patience (after 6 hours) and asked for explanations, (a dipstick test shouldnâ€™t take more than 5 mins) we have been sent home and asked to bring another urine sample the next morning, as the one they took in the A&N got lost. We gave them another sample (2 days ago) and since then, no one bothered to tell us the results, what is wrong with the baby.. what should we do or go, or if there is any treatmentâ€¦ children under 3 months are considered high risk and emergencies.. well.. my baby has fever still and no sign from the hospital in 2 days. They went radio silent.. If we try to callâ€¦ noone seems to know what are we talking about (apart from long time waiting on the line to pick up). This kind of service worries me, as Stoke Mandeville is the nearest hospital. I wish I would never need to go back there!

title: Diabetic care on wards
body:
Year after year I have the same problem with diabetic care for a relative on the wards. 
No real consistency with staff on wards and knowledge of diabetics care monitoring sugars not a problem, But not listening when patient knows what course of action suits them when high or low. As everyone is different. Often not washing patients hands when checking levels. Writing down notes with doses that are not readable in notes. 
So pleased that is to stop soon (no hand written notes) Leaving less room for error 
Diabetic speciality nurses are useful but ward staff change and opinions and knowledge is not consistent. 
Always a huge concern when leaving family member on a ward

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

author: COPD sufferer
title: A+E and my recent visit to it
body:
I was at A+E on Thursday my stats had dropped to 86 , thought I had pneumonia. The care I received was extraordinary, especially from a nurse named Catrina. She went way over and above her duty. I never felt in safer hands; her care, her attention to detail, she had a knack of making you relax , they were all excellent. I would like to thank this nurse in particular for such care and devotion to her job. She went way beyond her duties and I very much appreciated it. On top of that she had all the usual stuff to put up with in A+E . I think that place needs some security to alleviate the stuff that goes on and allow the staff to get on with their jobs of caring for people. Thank you again Catrina.  
[Unsure about 'Nurses']

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Unprofessional rude staff
body: Worst experience ever,i went there with my sister after scan they told us to go to day assessment unit but when we went there the staff were so rude and loud she even shouted at me and telling me to go down stairs i was so embarrassed as there were other people aswell.they have notice every where that they wont tolerate any disrespect to their staff what about the respect of patients.These staff members should give training on how to behave with patients

title: Not fit for purpose
body: I attended the A and E department with a severe asthma exacerbation twice in one day. The first time the doctor in duty asked me â€˜what do you want me to do?â€™ I was not asked about my asthma plan or asthma history and left without treatment. I phoned 111 in the evening and they told me to go back to the hospital. I arrived around 7pm and was not triaged/ seen by anyone until 11pm. National guidelines are that asthmatics suffering an attack must be treated within half an hour of arrival at the A and E. I was not seen by a doctor until 0145 the next morning. Again I was not asked about my asthma plan or asthma history. I had to suggest a nebuliser but after been given it, the machine was turned off by a health care assistant and I was sent back to the reception area. There was no assessment by the doctor to see if the nebuliser had helped - the doctor came out to the waiting room about ten minutes later - now about 3am to say go home and rest with no advice about follow up or what to watch for with the continuous wheezing I am still experiencing. I now know she should have sent a referral to my go for follow up within 48 hours. This was definitely not done. Itâ€™s not surprising as the whole place all night was completely chaotic. The triage system stopped working when the private sector provider didnâ€™t turn up. It was not a question of the A and E department being overly busy. All A and E departments are busy. There was no evidence of any working system. One staff member who I spoke to said the whole system was â€˜brokenâ€™.

readBy.name: Healthwatch North Yorkshire
York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: What constitutes as an 'emergency'?
body:
Attended A and E yesterday after dropping a pan of boiling water down my thigh. After seeking advice from 111, I was informed to go the A and E and that I had an appointment within 25 minutes. This burn spread the front and side of my thigh and blistered almost instantly, the burning sensation lasted hours - I was in absolute agony.

Upon arrival at the A and E, I was stood in the reception queue, in floods of tears in pain - I wasn't seen for close to ten minutes at reception, standing on the burnt leg, despite several nurses and staff walking past.

 I was then told, there was no appointments and that I could be waiting 2 hours, with patients having waited 20. Why is this appointment service in force? I truly wonder how long I could have been made to stand there excruciating pain.

Next, I was asked to sit and wait, having a panic attack due to the pain, my boyfriend was then asked to leave as it was "patient only". I cannot comprehend how grossly unfair this was in the circumstances.

After 10-15 minutes, a receptionist took it upon herself to rush me through to give me something for the pain, and I'm very thankful for her doing so and I was finally seen.

However, the treatment received in A and E was just as bad. After being seen in a triage bay I felt like a burden - one doctor came in and saw me for a maximum of 15 seconds, stating 'first degree' . He then left. I sat for a further 15 minutes in excruciating pain, with several nurses coming into my bay to grab things they needed (chairs, BP machines - not for me), and nobody updating me on my treatment or giving me anything to cool the burn. After close to 20 minutes in the treatment bay, I asked a nurse in the state I was in why nobody was helping and finally received a dose of morphine. The burn was evidently severe for morphine to be given. 

After 20 minue passed, a doctor I hadn't seen before asked me to leave my bay and I was placed on a staff chair. 

My leg was eventually dressed, to which a doctor came over and stopped the nurse in her tracks stating the dressing must be removed due to heat, to which it was torn back off. Unnecessary. I was then told I was discharged on ibuprofen, I had to beg for a stronger painkiller. 

5 different people treated me, each not knowing the previous persons actions. 

The whole A and E process from start to finish was a mess. It was grossly unfair. I attended in agony, severely distressed from the pain and had to beg for help. I truly wonder how long I could have sat if that lady at reception hadn't took it upon herself to rush me through. This morning, I'm left with 10 blisters over 50p in size, no dressing, with burning continuing. I will be attending my walk in centre to have this dealt with. 

To pride themselves on the values this hospital does, and leave a patient unseen in so much pain is frankly, unbelievable.

The NHS is at its capacity, staff are overwhelmed, but this is showing in patient care. If that wasn't an emergency - what is.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely doctors and nurses, shame about theâ€¦
body: The doctors and nurses have always been helpful and caring - but unfortunately the booking system is anything but straightforward to navigate. More often than not, getting through (after redialling several times to negate the â€˜line is busyâ€™ dial tone) via phone takes at least 30mins. There is no online booking system. Bookings are only taken 48 hours in advance. Appointments are often unavailable altogether. This almost feels like getting a booking has been made as inconvenient as possible. The NHS is under huge strain, but there has to be a solution for this.

title: No help
body: Rang at about 5 in the evening, didn't receive a call until 8 which was just someone telling me it's busy, the same person then rang me again at midnight, 4 in the morning and then at 6:30, each time I stated the pain was getting worse and more insistant but still haven't received any real medical advice

title: Terrible practice
body: I had a knee problem I paid for mri scan as nhs didn't do me one on my knee .report came back torn acl pcl and torn meniscus.phone penn to make an appointment they said send the report which I did.when I saw the doctor 2 weeks later they hadn't idea what I had come for.shpwed them the report the doctor said he would refer me straight away.2 weeks later I phoned the referral is still sitting in there system. The receptionist did not know about nhs book and choose system either. I have been at the practice 60 years but it as now become so bad I have moved to another practice

title: Make appointments on line
body: Sat for 1 hour looking how to do  appointment for my wife and not me . The site is to complicated for someone  who doesn't do this type of thing will not bother again. In my opinion they should be easy.  Waiting 20 minutes on a phone is better than a hour or more on a poor site

title: Absolutely shocking practice
body:
Canâ€™t get an appointment
Receptionist spout the same scripted message over and over
Canâ€™t book an appointment in advance
Have to phone on the morning, by the time u ring all appointments have gone
Need to know a week in advance your going to be ill and need a GP
Thereâ€™s no flexibility for people who work full time and need an appointment around their work hours
Can now book an e-consult which involves answering endless questions. If you miss the call from the GP you have to rebook and start the process all over again

title: Poor service
body:
Beginning to improve slowly but during last two years the service has been poor. Tried to move to another medical centre but they only accept those moving into area. Have not seen a doctor in three year's and had to go to A&E five times in 2021 and admitted to
hospital as result. Telephone response time poor and seeing a doctor almost impossible. Most contact was with a nurse over the telephone which is not much help  when you cannot breath properly or have a pain. Strongly advise against registering with this practice.

title: Excellent GP Practice
body: I have been using this surgery from the last 20 years and very pleased to say that I have received an Excellent service from the doctors and also from the reception staff. Being a diabetic and asthmatic patient I mostly get reminder messages from the reception to book my appointments for foot check, asthma check etc. I can also phone to the surgery and book my routine appointments. For emergency appointments, I queue up at the surgery well in time to book my appointment. The doctors in this surgery are very professional, skilled and caring doctors who listen to my issues, inform us about my situation and prescribe the medicines . All the doctors and admin staff working here work tirelessly more than 10 hours a day serving all of us. We should cooperate with them and show our gratitude to them.

title: abysmal
body: Despite calling at 8am& 8.15am as advised, the lines were still closed - at 8.29 I joined the queue at number 20 only to be put on hold for 40 minutes for a 30 second discussion with the receptionist who could not offer me a single appointment and advised I call 111 if its that much of an emergency or alternatively call again the following day and chance it. Ive loathed this practice for years but tolerated it as i believed most GP surgery's are just as bad but now i feel the situation at New Hayesbank is untenable. For the individuals that find it a struggle to even decide to seek help from their GPc, this surgery is a consistent let down.

title: Needs improvement
body: Appointments are difficult to get the phone at 8.30 is rediculous especially for single parents juggling children aswell . E consult had the dr tell me to ring in the morning to get appointment but was unable to after being on hold for 20 minutes . This will Proberly happen again tomorrow not helpful for people who suffer anixety and it takes a lot just to call let alone to be told no appointments very unfair system

title: Poor reception service
body: Waiting in queue for 20+ minutes only to wait another 30+ minutes for the receptionist to answer the telephone. She was abrupt and told me I was lying and I had not been Waiting that long for an answer. Very poor service when I have strict time constraints at work and I needed to make a quick phone call to find out my results. This has happened on several occasions where I have put the phone down due to the call taking to long to answer.

title: Wonderful caring practice.
body:
I've been a patient with Minster Surgery since early 2014, and in all that time I have always found the staff and doctors  to be helpful, professional and caring. I feel lucky to live in a village with such an amazing surgery. You hear so many awful things about dreadful practices.
I can only speak from my own experiences and I'm totally satisfied with my care by this surgery. Even during the worst of Covid lockdowns the docs and staff remained courteous and caring. 10/10 .Thank you all so much!

title: Telephone System
body: I had been referred to the dental hospital by my primary care dentist. I received an appointment through the post and for the last three days I have been trying to cancel this appointment due to being called into work. I was 1st in the queue for 18 mins then the line cut off! Then I called back straight away and got the message that the appointment center was now closed! I have called and called to try to cancel this appointment but have not been able to get through! This will now go down as a DNA and I will be discharged from the dental hospital despite the fact I have tried on numerous occasions to cancel this appointment!

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unfair treated
body: My appointment was @9morning I came before my time. They called by the doctor all came after me. I am still waiting now it's 10:25. I asked the nurse but she said next and nothing happened still calling another patients. So unfair treated

title: Great Practice
body: Have been registered with this Practice since 80s. My wife has since late 80s. This review related to a phone call to book an appointment. Whilst there is a delay, with patience, you get through even when 7th in line. Helpful and friendly. I have always found the doctors, nurses a office staff friendly and courteous. My wife is diabetic and when she went on the 6wks guidance course, when we discussed the support we get and what others get we get a 5* service some as low as 1* or 2 *, so we are very lucky.

title: Pointless
body:
Visited in April to order repeat prescription, ordered at desk upstairs, it's 10th May today, still no repeat prescription at Boots Chemist
What is the point of calling in ???? To order repeat prescription if its not going to be forwarded to chemist ?.

title: Poor Service, not fit for purpose?
body:
Have a very sore throat due to COVID not able to eat or sleep with it.

Over the counter products not working so phoned 8:00 am engaged, phone answered 8:15 told all appointments taken.

Phoned 111 explained symptoms, the person I spoke to put me on hold and contacted the surgery to see if a Doctor would give me a call back. They refused to do so and told 111 that I should try again in the morning.

Atrocious way to treat people.

title: Doctors great when you see them but...
body: Other staff need training in being sympathetic and understand what is going on in someones head. Worst scenarios etc. I've needed to contact the doctors for an ongoing condition that is still being investigated. As recommended I followed all guidelines to go through EConsult. This failed saying I need to contact the practice as could be urgent. I ring, tell them econsult said so, they couldn't help, had to try again next day (and you wonder why the hospitals are so busy!). I ring the next day, finally get an appointment (not with a doctor). Never have I felt so useless and alone. They made me feel like I was wasting their time. They never looked at any notes I made (I struggle to communicate things in person). I'm anxious that I have something seriously wrong, and they didn't have a caring bone in their body. Wanted me out as soon as possible. They recommended trying to take ibruprofen to ease some symptoms. Told them I can't as had an allergic reaction to it. Their response was that it was an uncommon reaction and to try again! Seriously! On a positive, when you finally get through to a doctor, they have been great.

title: Wrong information
body: Waited on the phone for 1 hour, when finally got through explained I needed my ear syringing. She booked me into see the nurse a week later. When I got there I waited 30 minutes only to be told by the receptionist that I need to make an appointment to see a doctor and that they don't do ear syringing.

title: Poor service
body: I requested an extension to my fit note via E-Consultation as I normally do. I did this on Friday 29/4/22, start time for note 3/5/22.  I appreciate that there is a waiting time, in this case it was Thursday evening 5/5/22. When I hadnâ€™t received it by that time I sent an online reminder as instructed. Up to Wednesday morning 11/5/22 I have still not received my texted note. I was sent a text on Friday 6/5/22 to say my request was with a doctor but have otherwise received no communication whatsoever. I have spoken to the practice receptionist on 3 occasions but cannot get any information and cannot get an appointment or a call back from a doctor to discuss it due to unavailability. This is completely unacceptable as I have been absent from work long-term due to mental health issues and this is exacerbating my stress levels. My workplace are pressing me to produce a note and the whole business is causing me great difficulty.

title: Trying to leave practice
body: Have not been to the doctors for a few years. Went for a smear test and was shocked at the state of the surgery. It looks like a prison in reception. Bare grey walls, 8 chairs, 2 doctors and a nurse? No wonder it takes a month to see a doctor. No body there except one other person. Receptionist blunt and rude. Changing GP as soon as I can. Unfortunately there is currently a moratorium in place at the moment such that patients are unable to switch between practices. As soon as that ends I will be leaving and going elsewhere.

title: Some very good Drâ€™s
body: Shame they are let down by front of staff, reception and lack of online use, every time need to call them your waiting over an hour for a rude obnoxious receptionist to deal with, well this was the final straw for me. I wholeheartedly do not recommend this surgery

title: Unanswered 5 Hour Call
body:
Rang the GP surgery on the new number for a callback Doctorâ€™s appointment

Rang 8am-1pm

No answer

Have telephone records to prove it

Medical condition serious. Not spoken to a Doctor since February, 2020. Condition very much likely to decline. Canâ€™t jump over hurdles when healthy, let alone ill like this 

There is no email or messaging service neither. Iâ€™m really suffering here and have been for a long time

Just want an appointment. Doesnâ€™t even have to be today if theyâ€™re busy. Within the month will be ok

This isnâ€™t on at all. System needs changing desperately

Canâ€™t you get people to fill out an online form and triage from there? That way everyone gets seen in order of priority now or in the near future. Itâ€™s very simple, especially with the technology we have today. Same day appointments for seriously ill patients and future appointments for others

You seriously need to do something. There are a number of GPs at this surgery. There is no shortage. Therefore, the appointments system needs a desperate improvement. Thatâ€™s all!

(still in a queue above 30 since 8am, itâ€™s now 1pm)

HELP!!!

title: Total nightmare
body:
Been waiting 13
 days for a phone call did not recieve 604 calls morning and aftermoon 2hrz hanging on in a que.
